intro: Haplopappus menziesii, commonly known as the narrowleaf horseweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Haplopappus menziesii is often found in the western United States and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
